alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 1:44AM PDT until August 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR LOS ANGELES COUNTY... At 144 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated increased rain rates with another band of rain, that is now expanding westward across the county towards West Hollywood and into the San Fernando Valley. Rates of 0.5-1.0 inch per hour are occuring in the Eastern San Gabriel mountains and foothills. Dangerous and life threatening flash flooding is occuring again in the warned area. Rock and mudslides are occurring. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, up to 7 inches in the mountains. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area, highest in the mountains. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Rain from Tropical Storm Hilary producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Burbank, Glendora, Arcadia, Pasadena, Glendale, Alhambra, Altadena, Azusa, La Verne, Pomona, Duarte, Monrovia, and La Canada Flintridge, including the Fish burn scar. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
